current_role.title: Staff Software Engineer (Front End Lead)
current_role.focus: Leading frontend teams, distributed systems architecture, AI-enhanced engineering
current_role.team_size: 4 developers (ranging from junior to 10+ years experience)
responsibilities: Managing small but diverse frontend team
Key architecture decisions and platform-wide roadmap planning
Reducing tech debt and upgrading build/runtime systems
Leading internal tool development for feature flags and translations
current_excitement: Managing the frontend team and watching them grow
Working across domains on the configurator (feature flags & translations tool)
Reducing tech debt through major version upgrades (TypeScript, build tools)
Integrating AI-augmented workflows into daily practice
Cutting out boilerplate work to focus on important architecture decisions

frontend.ember_experience: Currently working professionally with Ember/Glimmer at PowerAuctions - deep expertise in modern Ember patterns, Glimmer components, and Octane conventions

backend.phoenix_notes: Functional programming paradigm is intuitive - love piping and data transformations

ai_tooling.impact: Cuts out boilerplate/busy work to focus on architecture decisions
ai_tooling.philosophy: Ramping up open source contributions with AI assistance

loves: TypeScript - very solid, great type safety
Ember.js/Glimmer - convention over configuration, powerful CLI, stable ecosystem
Vite - fast and great for local development
Component-based architecture - converged ecosystem makes switching frameworks easier
opinions.open_to: New technologies - very open-minded about trying new things
opinions.wishlist: Frameworks that allow mixing multiple frontend libraries in one app
common_mistakes: Spending too much time on tests/mocking vs actual development
Trying to accommodate all cases equally when cost/benefit diminishes

daily_routine.morning: Most productive with code in the morning - start early reviewing MRs or planning
daily_routine.meetings: Prefer bundled meetings with at least 2 hours of focus time
daily_routine.end_of_day: Review work done, plan for next day

mentoring_approach.frequency: Weekly check-ins on feelings and blockers
mentoring_approach.feedback_style: Detailed feedback on work, guide through problem-solving
mentoring_approach.teaching: Share best practices and reasoning behind code decisions

remote_work_tips.environment: Dedicated office space, noise machine, shut door for focus
remote_work_tips.boundaries: Set start/end times, shut down computer at end of day
remote_work_tips.focus: Listen to music matching mood, minimize interruptions when possible
remote_work_tips.philosophy: Allow interruptions but protect focus time

code_review_philosophy.ideal: Equal positive and negative feedback in comments
code_review_philosophy.mindset: MR/PR makes contribution shared - code becomes co-owned after merge

achievements: 100% uptime on 10+ auction platforms valued at $40B+

career_advice.breaking_into_tech: Be persistent, fake it till you make it. Move forward with insatiable curiosity and skepticism. Learn by doing!
career_advice.switching_domains: Just give it a shot. Use AI to help bridge the language barrier between backend/frontend.
career_advice.leadership_development: Learn by doing and applying yourself. Background in finance and video games helped - persistence and adaptability.
career_advice.philosophy: Don't be afraid to take things apart to understand them

side_projects.future_goal: Contribute more with AI augmentation, especially in climate science
side_projects.consulting: Not currently, but interested in smaller moonlight projects
side_projects.passion: Love bringing ideas to life in software

parenting_balance.boundaries: Setting boundaries ensures productivity at end of day

background: Co-founded Morano Gelato with sister in 2010 after living in Paris for 2 years
Sister apprenticed with Sicilian gelato chef in Florence, Italy
Started business during cross-country road trip, between finance and development careers
Supported sister's passion - her excitement was contagious
Learned persistence and tenacity overcoming catch-22 hurdles (like needing 5yr history for bank funding)
Memorable last day: squeezed 50 lemons with cuts on fingers, chocolate base explosion
Realized he enjoyed eating gelato more than making it - didn't share sister's passion for the business
Grew up around family's restaurant business
Career transition from finance to tech in 2014

contact.availability_note: Open to full-time roles, consulting projects, advisory roles, and speaking opportunities
